question: What is a slide master?
correct_answer: A template that controls the look and feel of all slides in a presentation.
incorrect_answers: The first slide in a presentation.
A type of animation that can be applied to text.
A feature that allows you to add comments to your slides.

question: Which of the following is NOT a slide layout element?
What is the purpose of slide transitions?
correct_answer: To control the way one slide moves to the next.
incorrect_answers: To add animations to objects on a slide..
To add sounds to your presentation.

question: How can you add images to a PowerPoint slide?
incorrect_answers: By using the Insert > Picture option.
By dragging and dropping the image file onto the slide.
By copying and pasting the image into the slide.

question: What does the "5/5/5" rule refer to in PowerPoint design?
correct_answer: No more than 5 words per line, 5 lines per slide, and 5 text-heavy slides in a row.
incorrect_answers: No more than 5 minutes of presentation time, 5 words per line, and 5 lines per slide.
No more than 5 slides per presentation, 5 words per line, and 5 minutes of presentation time.
No more than 5 seconds of animation per slide, 5 words per line, and 5 minutes of presentation time.
